page.title: 14Sports in Radley
page.content: here is a flourishing Boys' Football Club, run by volunteer managers and coaches. Matches are played on the pitch by the Village Hall, off Foxboro' Rd. In 1984-5, the teams were arranged by age: Under 10, Under 11, Under 13, Under 16. These age groups move up each year. Apart from local league matches, a tour to Belgium is arranged for one or other of the teams, every 2 or 3 years. In 1985 the Under 10's and the under 11's teams won the Oxford Supersports Cups, played on Oxford United and Oxford City grounds. A Radley CRICKET team plays Saturday and Sunday fixtures during the summer. During the Radley College holidays, all home matches are played on their 2nd Xl pitch; before then all games are played away from home. In recent years the Club has been very successful, losing very few games.
